main.name: Anthony Parker Ryan
main.description: I'm also a sound designer, aspiring mycologist, UX designer, and sci-fi aficionado (of course).
main.contactmessage: Interested in my work? Feel free to reach out and say hello!

resume.skillmessage: While building solutions at work, at school, or on hobby projects, I've rapidly picked up a variety of skills - in a variety of depths!

work.company: Center for Robotics and Biosystems at Northwestern
work.title: Research Assistant
work.description:
Designed and rapid prototyped robotic agents and control systems using wireless communications with ESP32 BLE and Wi-Fi, as well as localization with machine vision and control theory implemented in C/C++. 
Trained and managed a team of undergraduate researchers in novel software tools and CAD modeling projects. 
Performed and analyzed experiments on live mice and robotic agents, involving hardware (PCB design and soldering) & software (networking and computer vision) debugging, as well as vocal spectrographic analysis. Built an autonomous predator agent to chase a live rodent prey using machine vision assisted localization, autonomous control theory, and custom built C++ software. Used ESP32 chips for wireless communications, analyzed efficiency and latency across low-level networking methods and optimized data packet size to deliver mapping responses in 3-8ms actionable window. Simulated motor functionality in Python, used CAD for chassis and wheel design, and Eagle for circuit design. Performed data analysis on experiments using the autonomous prey agent with pandas and matplotlib libraries. Trained and managed a team of five undergraduate researchers in novel custom software tools

work.title: Software Engineer
work.description: Created a booking and membership management application in Swift for iOS with ~125k monthly active users. Established a React JS powered online booking flow with AWS and integration into Shopify e-commerce, bringing in $500k/year of online product and service sales. Collaborated with the marketing, customer service, and in-store management teams to develop an automated client entry workflow in python, resulting in a 70% reduction in human error and a 20% increase in employee utilization rate. Incorporated analytics from external marketing avenues into web and mobile tracking flows to reduce customer drop-off by 50% and increase cart size through personalized recommendations and targeted ads

work.title: Software Intern
work.description: Worked intermittently with a small team of programmers and independently, updated and debugged the Wonder iOS App, used several technologies to create helper apps including Docker, Zapier, Slack, and AWS Lambda Headless Servers, working interchangeably in PHP, Python, and Swift. Additionally, lead the Wonder team to an integration with SUGARED + BRONZED in order to provide clients with real time rewards for purchases.
